plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid deciduous tree known for its large, fragrant, tulip-shaped flowers that appear before the leaves. It is a very popular ornamental tree in temperate zones.
plants.location: Temperate regions, widely cultivated in North America, Europe
plants.funFact: Saucer Magnolia was one of the earliest hybrid magnolias developed in France in the 1820s, combining large blooms with hardiness.

plants.name: Cherry Blossom (Prunus serrulata)
plants.description: Iconic ornamental cherry tree known for its spectacular ephemeral pink or white flowers, signaling spring in many parts of the world.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late March to early May depending on region
plants.location: East Asia (Japan, Korea, China), cultivated worldwide in temperate climates
plants.funFact: Cherry blossoms only last about 1-2 weeks in full bloom, and their fleeting beauty is celebrated with annual festivals called Hanami in Japan.

plants.name: Strelitzia reginae
plants.description: Tropical plant known for striking, bird-like flowers resembling a tropical bird in flight. It thrives in warm climates and often blooms year-round in ideal conditions.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in frost-free areas, peaks from late winter to late spring
plants.location: Native to South Africa; cultivated in subtropical & tropical gardens worldwide

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A perennial wildflower often grown in gardens for its tall, dense spikes of pea-like flowers. It is a nitrogen-fixing legume which improves soil quality.
plants.location: Native to western North America, widely naturalized in Europe and New Zealand
plants.funFact: Lupines have a unique structure allowing them to fix nitrogen in the soil via symbiotic bacteria, enriching poor soils.
